net.objectzoo.delegates

Interface Action0

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Event0AsyncDelegate, Event0Delegate
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Action0AsyncSupport, Action0ToAsyncAction0, Event0AsyncAdapter, Event0Caller, Event0Distributor
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Action0
    An Action0 is a reference to a procedure without return value that can be invoked synchronously similar to a regular Java method call.
    Author:
    tilmann

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Action0 from(Supplier<?> supplier)
      Converts the given Supplier into an Action0 that invokes the supplier and then ignores its return value.
      void start()
      Invoke this Action0
      static Consumer<Action0> startingConsumer()
      Creates a Consumer that calls start() on the consumed Action0s.
      default Runnable toRunnable()
      Wraps this Action0 in a Runnable
      static Runnable toRunnable(Action0 action0)
      Wraps the given Action0 in a Runnable

        supplier - the supplier to be converted
        Returns:
        the action invoking the supplier
